p: Results: Data was collected on 617 pts referred to CC between November 2013 and October 2014, of whom 344 (55.8%) were made out of hours, 279 (45.2%) were admitted. Median age was 65 (50-74) years, 311 (50.4%) were male and the median LOS prior to referral was 2 (0-2) days. The median CCFS, MET grading and EWS were 4 (3-6), 4 (0-6) and 4 (2-6) respectively. The majority of referrals came from the medical specialties (246 pts, 39.9%), directly from the emergency department (190 pts, 30.8%) and the surgical specialties (129, 20.9%). The most common comorbidities were cardiovascular (238 pts, 38.6%) diseases, respiratory (141 pts, 22.9%) and diabetes (108 pts, 17.5%). The most common referral reason was sepsis (140 pts, 22.7%), with post-operative monitoring accounting for 61 referrals (10%). At age and gender adjusted logistic regression analysis the EWS (OR per point 1.12, CI 1-1.25, p = 0.04), the CCFS (OR per point 0.79, CI 0.69-0.91, p = 0.001), ET > 30 yards (OR 2.5, CI 1.6-3.98, p < 0.001), self-caring status (OR 2.5, CI 1.6-3.97, p < 0.001) and housebound status (OR 0.38, CI 0.24-0.58, p < 0.001) influenced admission. The number of CC beds available, the LOS prior to referral and the MET grading did not.
